Job Title: Graduate Water/wastewater Engineer - 2024

Location: Iselin, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Country: United States

Position Location: Iselin, NJ

Contract Type: Regular (US only)

Work Pattern: Full Time

Sector: Water

Discipline: Water

Job Ref: 1960

Recruiter Contact: MM Recruiter

What you’ll be getting into...

From the moment you join us, you’ll be immersed in what it’s like to be an engineer at Mott MacDonald. You’ll work as part of a team of exceptional engineers who will support and mentor you. From your first week, you’ll gain a sense that you belong. Our terrific work culture focuses on valuing your creativity, promotes inclusion and diversity, and allows you to take ownership of your work.

As an entry-level engineer working with our growing water and wastewater treatment team, your responsibilities may include:

Treatment pilot study monitoring, sampling and data managementConceptual, preliminary and detaileddesign of water and wastewater treatment facilitiesDesign calculations for treatment unit sizing, chemical usage, and system hydraulicsTreatment facility site investigationsAssistance in the preparation and review of treatment evaluations, standard operating procedures, technical drawings, and specificationsUtilizing cutting-edge software with a “digital by default” approach

What else is involved?

We encourage a healthy work-life balance. We want you to not only enjoy what you do for Mott MacDonald but enjoy what you do in your personal time as well. Each of our offices have dedicated and active sports and social teams, offering discounted outings throughout the year. It's worth noting that committees tend to vary from office to office, so in addition to getting involved in what we already have to offer, don’t be afraid to suggest new events or initiatives that you think could be a great addition.

You’ll also have the opportunity to expand your social and professional network. Whether it be meeting other graduates at the graduate weekend residential course or joining one of our Equality, Diversity and Inclusivity networks.

With our performance and development reviews (PDRs), you will be able to effectively track and plan your personal and professional development with your line manager. We understand that each person’s career goals vary, therefore we tailor each employee’s development program to suit them. You can choose to focus on working towards achieving your Professional Engineer’s (PE) license with a mentor, along with building your technical and management skills.

Candidate Specifications

We are looking for flexible and motivated candidates with a genuine drive to be a successful engineering consultant and a desire to make a difference in the world. If this describes you, apply today to launch your career at Mott MacDonald.

To be considered for this entry-level position, you will be pursuing or recently graduated with a bachelor’s or master’s degreein civil, environmental or chemical engineering or related engineering degree. You should be able to demonstrate your interest in your chosen sector (water/wastewater) through relevant experience, such as relevant coursework, research, or previous work experience.

We Are Looking For Graduates With The Following Characteristics

Knowledge of treatment unit processes, water chemistry, and basic hydraulicsKnowledge/familiarity with Revit, AutoCAD and PowerBIMethodical approach to problem solving.Ability to use your initiative to undertake tasks efficiently and independently.Excellent verbal communication skills, which allow you to confidently liaise with clients and team members.Excellent written communication skills and attention to detail, which allow you to prepare clearly written and high-quality reports and technical documents.

Equality, diversity and inclusion

We put equality, diversity and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

Equal employment opportunity is the law.

Hybrid working policy

At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team, and personal commitments. We offer a hybrid working policy that embraces your well-being, flexibility, and trust.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
